result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Waara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A Waara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark A Waara was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $150 fine plus costs. If fine and costs are not paid in full by 9/1/16, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs (not including attorney fees) in full on or before 9/1/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 9/1/16, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report on or before 9/1/16.

Defendant Mark A Waara in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark A Waara in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who does not qualify for PD, had been laid off for a while. Atty Reetz will accept appointment. Court appoints Atty Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $100 per month starting 7/1/16.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Mark A Waara in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defendant got laid off, just got called back, started back to work yesterday. Defendant wants Court-appointed Counsel, hasn't had time to get the forms. Petition given to Defendant. Defendant needs to have an attorney by next Court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant appeared voluntarily.

Defendant Mark A Waara in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant, who overslept and didn't know where he was supposed to go, has been bouncing around between hotels, is working at Bay Ship 7 days a week. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on Counsel. Defendant just started working 7 days a week, is trying to save money for retainer. One attorney told him to request 30-60 days. Defendant has one picked out, thinks he can hire one by Friday. Court reviews possibility of Counsel entering written not guilty plea to avoid next appearance. Bond continues as is.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 2/23/16.
Defendant Mark A Waara not in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
by Matthew Schwantes

No violent contact with BW. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center. Not to enter into any bars or taverns, especially the Happy Hour in Valmy.

Defendant Mark A Waara appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/7/16, 10:00.
